Class Memory

java.lang.Object
  Memory
public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object

Provides simulated main memory for the ARC Computer. It can be read or written a word at a time.

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
C. Vickery

Constructor Detail

Memory

public Memory()
Method Detail

readWord

static int readWord(int address)
Returns a word of memory, given a byte address. Outputs a log message telling what value was read if Simulator.logReads is true.

Parameters:
address - The byte address of the word to be read.
Returns:
The value read from that address.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the address is not valid.

writeWord

static void writeWord(int address,
                      int dataValue)
Writes a word to memory, given the address and the data value. Outputs a log message telling what was stored if Simulator.logWrites is true.

Parameters:
address - The byte addrss of the word to be written.
dataValue - The data value to be written.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the address is not valid.

findFirst

static int findFirst()

Finds first non-zero word of memory, presumably the first executable instruction.

Note: If you manage to create a 4 GB memory, the highest word address will be 0xFFFFFFFC, which is not the same as the value used to indicate empty memory by this function.

Returns:
The byte address of the first word of memory that contains a non-zero value, or -1 if none.

clear

static void clear(int bytes)
Initializes memory to all zeros. Actually it creates a new array, so different invocations can work with memories of different sizes.

Parameters:
bytes - Number of bytes of memory to create.
Throws:
A - runtime error if the host does not have enough real memory for the number of bytes requested.
